originalText.text: This place is known to have regular barbecues so it's nice to come here and worship God and have a fun time with family members.

text.text: This place is known to have regular barbecues so it's nice to come here and worship God and have a fun time with family members.

originalText.text: I love this place. So important for the community. This building is more than a church. It holds a lot of events and groups, such as, Weight Watchers and karate classes. Please donate to preserve the building when you can. If you are looking for a spiritual group to join, even though OSA is Lutheran, they are very LGBT friendly and welcome everyone. I really enjoy the good vibes here.

text.text: I love this place. So important for the community. This building is more than a church. It holds a lot of events and groups, such as, Weight Watchers and karate classes. Please donate to preserve the building when you can. If you are looking for a spiritual group to join, even though OSA is Lutheran, they are very LGBT friendly and welcome everyone. I really enjoy the good vibes here.

originalText.text: I absolutely love this building. It houses so many programs and events for the community. I am not Lutheran and feel so welcomed here when I decide to attend service on Sundays. I grew up in Washington Heights and used to go to Girl Scout meetings at this building and church dances.I also used to work the Weight Watcher meetings here on Saturday and have participated in the art shows. It really is a pillar in the community. If you can please go to the OSA website and donate. The minimum is 3 dollars. It is so worth it. This building is not just a church, it is a community center welcoming to all. There is even a free dinner that happens every first Sunday of the month open to anyone who needs. Very nice pastor as well if you are ever thinking about going to service. Pastor John is awesome, kind and non judgmental. Like I said,  love this building.

originalText.text:
Great church open to progressive ideas. LGBTQ friendly and into fighting climate change by planning to use Thermal heating in the future. A magnet for neighborhood events. 12 steps programs abound.
Called the Cornerstone church it houses the Cornerstone Studios for Art and the Cornerstone center for everything else, the OSA Lutheran church on 189th and Bennett ave is a Haven for the members many of whom are children growing up in the Cornerstone manner: progressive in Christ.

originalText.text: It is so beautiful. The neighborhood is amazing. It is near #A train station and others bus transportation.  They offer some class to the community and others services.
